article_title: Virginia Is for Lovers of Obama-Style Power Plays
article_text:
Alexandria, Va.

For the latest proof that executive overreach is the guiding ethos of Democratic governance, look no further than Virginia Gov. Terry McAuliffe.

Virginia’s constitution gives the governor the power to temporarily fill vacancies on the state Supreme Court when the legislature is out of session. On Sept. 16, Gov. McAuliffe reappointed Fairfax County jurist Jane Marum Roush to the high court, even though the...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Bill McMorris writes about Virginia’s governor, who declares the state legislature is not in session and then does what he wants. Sound familiar?
twitter.title: Virginia Is for Lovers of Obama-Style Power Plays
